Question: A freshly baked loaf of bread is removed from the oven at a temperature of 109°C and placed in a room with an ambient temperature of 42°C. The rate constant \(k\) for the cooling process, according to Newton's Law of Cooling, is found to be \(0.06 \, \text{min}^{-1}\). Calculate the temperature of the loaf after 7 minutes. Provide your answer in °C and up to three decimal places.
